resources.string:
This will allow using quests added in SCEE, and ways of

editing raw tags

moving nodes that are part of ways or relations

deleting free-floating any node

editing elements which should be blocked by a note

adding free floating nodes anywhere

changing element selection of quests

 This is still less than most other editors allow, but incautious use may result in damaging data in ways that are not possible in StreetComplete. Be aware that by enabling expert mode you bear significantly more responsibility for your edits.
 Please only enable this setting if you have OSM experience outside StreetComplete and understand what you are doing.
Use comma to separate user names or IDs
Enter user names or IDs to ignore
Contrary to OSM notes, adding a GPX note will not hide any quest at the affected location
Swap OSM and GPX note buttons
Hides the keyboard when open before the note is actually created (to allow re-view of position)
When requesting to show all notes, show even notes created (or commented on) by yourself
Get GPX notes and attached photos and tracks
…as alternative to leaving a note. This can be used as locally stored note visible on the map. Note that you’ll need to enable custom quests.
Store full size versions of photos taken while creating notes, without clearing EXIF data
Displays arrows on highlighted lines when opening a quest. Useful e.g. when adding oneway.
Highlight ways and areas that have quests
They exist so white dots are hidden by quest pins
Show animation after solving a quest
This also controls the quest-solved sound
Download area covered by GPX track
Display map features from GeoJson file
If you want to display text, it must be in the \"name\" property
Select first edit on opening history
Allows for quicker undo, but moves camera automatically
Show all main menu items as grid
Capitalize all words when entering names
Display further quest for same element right after solving
Click hides quest temporarily, long click hides permanently
If form has more than %d line(s)
Move recent answers to front if the quest answer form has more than this many lines of images
Allows switching nearby quests when a quest form is shown
Show all types and hidden quests
Show quests within this distance (limited to 10 meters)
Feature search shows results in all system and local language
Automatically show keyboard when adding a node
Switch preset button in main menu
Disables the mode that tilts and auto-rotates the map
Automatically download data in the nearby area
When disabled, data will not be re-downloaded on manual download unless it’s older than 12 hours
Add imported, or replace existing? If you choose replace, all currently existing will be removed.
Warning: database version unknown, import may not work. Please ask for the app to be updated.
Remove downloaded OSM data if older than this many days
Get currently used file or provide a new one? Check the corresponding quest enable message for details.
Tile source for satellite / aerial images
See message when enabling quest for details
Disabling accelerates upload and stops achievement messages
Always resurvey these keys if there is no check date key. Check date will always be added on answering related quests
Instead of using resurvey intervals, resurvey above keys if check date older than:
Increase priority of quests suitable for current daytime
Don’t show quests unsuitable for current daytime
When enabled, quest settings are only valid for the current quest preset
Quests are created when loading the viewed area. Somewhat slow, but immediately applies changed quest settings.
Allow quests to be asked everywhere, even if originally disabled in some countries. Note that some quests still may not be overridden due to community consensus.
For properly applying all changed quest settings, re-scanning for quests is necessary.
Monitors location when the app is in background, except if backgrounded using back button
Background location permission is required for the nearby quest monitor to work
Set radius nearby quest search. Note that quests with slightly larger distance may also be found. Locations with accuracy worse than this value are ignored.
Actively requesting locations will increase battery use. When not actively requesting locations, locations requested by other apps will still be used.
Download data if necessary? This may considerably consume data and battery, and may be rendered useless by Android for battery saving reasons.
You can also manually choose which quests to restore by long-pressing the undo button.
Set elements eligible for this quest. Click here to open info on the element selection syntax in a browser.
Set highways eligible for this quest, comma separated
Set minimum distance from separate paths, if lower the quest will not be shown
Maximum value for (building levels) minus (roof levels) for the quest to be shown
Maximum length of steps in meters for the quest to be shown
Doctors and many more nodes inside multi-level buildings
Select issue severity levels to download and display
Resurvey all opening hours, including values not understood by SCEE? You may need to use the tag editor to enter the correct values.
Require entering roof levels in most countries (default)

Set which tags should be used for the label, in given order. An empty string will never show any labels, \"label\" will show the default StreetComplete name label using name, brand, ref, local_ref and operator.
Also ask leaf type for single trees?
Enter level value, or filter using > and <. Use * to match all elements containing an allowed level key
Leave empty to show not tagged

These quests are downloaded from Osmose service and indicate potential problems with OSM data. Download only happens if at least one severity level is selected in quest settings.\n The Osmose message is displayed with the quest, any edit reports the issue as solved.\n It is also possible to report the problem as false positive; this cannot be undone.
This will interfere with items that are ignored by subtitle
Are you sure? This cannot be undone!

Use for checking specific pre-defined elements or locations. You can also specify tags and add a node with them. To use it, load a file in the main settings menu, containing either \`type,id,message\` (e.g. NODE,1234,check position) or \`latitude,longitude,message\`. For adding nodes, put the tags in the message after \'addNode\', e.g. addNode amenity=restaurant,wheelchair=no,diet:vegetarian=yes
You can add a node with: %s
For which sport is this guidepost intended?
If there is anything not covered by the features listed, please leave a note instead.
"This is just a simple guidepost with no specific sports."
Is this pharmacy dispensing all prescription drugs?
This \"quest\" shows POIs like benches or picnic tables as brown dots. Click the dot to show details and other answers.
This \"quest\" shows bicycle-related POIs as purple dots. Click the dot to show details and other answers.
This \"quest\" shows shop, restaurants, doctors and similar POIs as orange dots. Click the dot to show details and other answers.
This \"quest\" shows surveillance features as pink dots. Click the dot to show details and other answers.
This \"quest\" shows POIs like ATMs, phones or vending machines as blue dots. Click the dot to show details and other answers.
This \"quest\" shows miscellaneous POIs like hydrants, viewpoints or toilets as yellow dots. Click the dot to show details and other answers.
This \"quest\" shows recycling/garbage related POIs as green dots. Click the dot to show details and other answers.
This \"quest\" shows traffic-related POIs as light blue dots. Click the dot to show details and other answers.
This \"quest\" shows vacant shops as grey dots. Click the dot to show details and other answers.
This \"quest\" shows FixMes as red dots (with default exceptions of \'yes\' and \'continue\'). Click the dot to show details and other answers.
It has an excrement bag dispenser
"What is the number of this piste?"
Is there a swimming pool here?
What kind of service building is this?
Substations that mainly relates to regional distribution networks
A small substation at the lowest level of transforming in the distribution grid
Dedicated to industrial or heavy business activities feeding
Electrical substation that converts power to supply railways, trams or trolleybuses with traction current
Control gear of an electric power system
A structural facility to access ground water, created by digging or drilling
Large man-made tank for holding fresh water
Facility including pumps for pumping water from one place to another
Service building related to waste water collection, transmission or processing
Facility including pumps for pumping oil from one place to another
Facility including pumps for pumping gas from one place to another
Gas distribution substation in a building in charge of dropping pressure towards consumers in surroundings
Building for heating transmission and distribution towards industries and domestic consumers (district heating)
Place to connect landlines subscribers to telecommunication service equipments
Place to connect internet subscribers to internet service equipments
A structure that allows ventilation in railway underground tunnels
Stationary railroad system for control of railway operations
A shed to protect locomotives and rolling stock from the environment
A building in which a train washing facility is located
Vertical construction allowing air exchange for non-railway infrastructure
A station located in a own building that monitors something
What kind of street cabinet is this?
Next to the curb, or where parking used to be
On a balcony (not on the ground floor)
On a veranda/porch (roofed, can be slightly above ground)
What kind of outdoor seating does this place have?
What kind of shelter is this?

This quest is disabled by default because it’s not easy to answer. The shelter type must be chosen from suggestions, which are taken from most used values and these are often not easy to differentiate.
This is a generic weather shelter
What types of valves are available here?
This quest is disabled by default because it requires a very close inspection of the available valves.
What kind of artwork is this?
"What is the Trail Visibility of this way?"
"This quest type is disabled by default because the rating of the trail visibility is highly subjective and needs expert knowledge in the used grading system."
"Unambiguous path or markers everywhere. Orientation unproblematic, no map required."
"Path or next marker always visible, but sometimes has to be searched for. Basic sense of direction needed, map recommended."
"Path mostly visible, no markers. Good sense of direction needed, map required."
"Path sometimes invisible, route partly pathless, no markers. Basic skills in orientation required."
"Often pathless, no markers. Advanced orientational skills required."
"Mostly pathless, no markers. Excellent orientational skills required."
"What overall color does this building have?"
"What overall color does this building part have?"
"What overall color does this building’s roof have?"

This quest type is disabled by default because roofs are often not easily visible from the street. This quest type is also quite time-consuming; in most cases it is easier and more efficient to map this from aerial imagery at home.
What kind of map is this?
A map with topographical background for e.g. a historical or hiking map. The map contains contour lines.
A map with all streets or ways of an area. The streets are mostly named. The angles, distances etc. are accurate. Used e.g. at tourist offices for the accommodation overview.
A sketched map with only important ways and POIs. The angles, distances etc. are merely illustrative, not accurate. Used e.g. by travel agencies to explain their tours.
A marker erected on high places which indicates the direction to notable landscape features which can be seen from that point. Often used with viewpoints.
What area is covered by this map?
A site, e.g. a park or a zoo
A larger area with e.g. multiple villages
A whole landscape, mostly used on toposcopes
"What is the Via Ferrata Scale of this ferrata?"

"This quest type is disabled by default because the rating of via ferrata routes is highly subjective and needs expert knowledge in the used grading system and when climbing via ferrata, as this requires advanced mountaineering skills. As there is no "world wide scale" for via ferrata difficulty, the German Huesler scale is used here."

"Difficulty low; terrain varies from flat to steep; some exposed sections. Secured with cables, chains or brief ladders. Requires surefootedness; fine for the unsporty. Ferrata set optional for most."
"Good natural steps or hewn stairs, short ladders or iron steps. Exposed passages are fitted with cables, chains or ropes for handrails rails. Experienced mountaineers may choose not to clip in."
"Steep or vertical passages are fitted with ladders or iron steps. Steel cables and chains secure the climber, even in less difficult terrain. Ferrata set strongly advised."
"Some technical climbing, but nothing that requires particularly strong arms. Ferrata set necessary."
"Steep terrain with continuous steel cables to attach to. Arm strength required. Artificial aids (iron steps, handholds) on hardest sections."

"Long, persistently demanding and very strenuous. Exposed terrain may only have cables for safety, these are reserved only for places that would other wise be impossible to cross. For experienced climbers."
"Long sparsely secured gymnastic circuits that require real stamina. Climbing shoes may be useful. Additional security to be provided by rope or belaying (recommended)"
"This quest type is disabled by default because the classification and use of the tag is not commonly used."
"Village - a stopover near a smaller village."
"Town - a stopover near a bigger town."
"River - the site is located directly on the river."
"Lake - the site is located directly on the lake."
"Parking Lot - directly on a parking lot."
"Winery - staying at a winery, often right next to vineyards."
"Camp site - a separate motorhome stopover at a campsite."
"Museum - located at a museum, exhibition or similar."
"Restaurant - at a restaurant or cafe, often on the parking lot."
"Beach - next to a beach or by the sea."
"Supermarket - on the parking lot of a supermarket."
What is the phone number of this place?
What is the website of this place?
What cuisine does this place have? Use suggested OSM tags!
Which beer brands are served here?
Many brands of beer are served here
"Who is the operator for this service building?"
What healthcare specialities does this place have?
This quest requires knowledge about the healthcare:speciality tags. Without this knowledge, the quest can be very difficult to answer.
What is the genus or species of this tree?
Not recognized. Try entering the genus, species or english name of the tree. Otherwise, consider leaving a note.

This quest is disabled by default because it’s not easy to answer. Species/Genus must be chosen from suggestions, which are taken from most used values. You can provide suggestions from your own list of species with searchable names by providing a file in the data management settings menu, containing \`<species> (<name>)\`.
Quests added in SCEE are always disabled by default, as they may not always be answerable, and may require knowledge of the topic and tagging.
Which tag to use for tracks accessible from this platform? According to OSM wiki, local_ref may be preferable, but actual usage is mostly ref.

Note that which tag to use best is not entirely clear in the wiki and thus left to the user. Choose between \'ref\' (default) and \'local_ref\' in the quest settings.\n If there are two tracks along a platform, use semicolon separated values, e.g. 2;3
Which destinations are signed for this road?
"How wide is the foot path here?"
Fill in at least one language
No seating, but not takeout only
Set \"construction=…\", or leave empty if unknown
Select the default limit before selecting this answer
Do not use GPS altitude, as it typically is too inaccurate and not provided in the correct height reference system.
Reference number of this map or guidepost, not the reference number of signed routes.
Signed (location) name of this map or guidepost. Do not enter a reference number here.

This quest is disabled by default because what is signed strongly varies by region and operator. You may need to refine the element selection for your area (e.g. add or remove maps, only select elements with hiking=yes, etc.)
Is there easily enough space for even the tallest trucks (at least about 4.5 meters / 15 feet) to pass through?
Enable extension of \"Does this crossing have markings on the ground?\", allows you to define the style of crossing markings

This quest is disabled by default because what is signed strongly varies by region and operator. You may need to refine the element selection for your area (e.g. remove street lamps, add maps, only select guideposts with hiking=yes, etc.)
What is the difficulty of this piste?
How many cars can park here?
This also includes special spaces like for disabled people, families, for charging etc. Hide the quest if the parking spaces are not marked and thus not countable
How many parking spaces for disabled people are here?

Quests added in SCEE are always disabled by default, as they may not always be answerable, and may require knowledge of the topic and tagging.\nThis quest will not be asked if capacity:disabled=yes is set. If you want to specify them as well, change the element selection from \"and !capacity:disabled\" to \"and (!capacity:disabled or capacity:disabled=yes)\"
In what orientation do cars park here?
Search all paths even those who are not in a hiking relation
"What is the SAC Scale of this path?"

"This quest type is disabled by default because the sac scale of path is highly subjective and needs expert knowledge in the used grading system and. As there is no "world wide scale" for path difficulty, the SAC Mountain and Alpine Hiking Scale is used here."
"Smooth, level trail with no obstacles, suitable for all footwear, strollers, or crutches, and requires no orientation skills."
"Terrain level or slightly inclined; no risk of falling with appropriate behaviour."
"Terrain is steep in places and may pose fall hazards."
"Portions of the route exposed with danger of falling. Trail may have unmarked portions and cross fields of loose scree or talus."
"Terrain already quite exposed, including steep grassy pitches, talus slopes, easy snowfields, or snow-free glacier crossings."
"Exposed and demanding terrain. May include steep rock scrambles, glaciers and snowfields with risk of sliding."
"Severe exposure. Difficult craggy terrain. Glaciers with high risk of sliding."
What kind of lamp is this?
This quest is disabled by default because it’s not easy to answer and might be spammy depending on the region.
This quest is disabled by default because it might be spammy depending on the region.
What type is this post office?
Post office (privatly owned, perhaps with restricted service)
Post relay point in shops or amenities (as a service)

Click the link below to open information about the element selection syntax in a browser. Note that when selecting elements by age, the resurvey interval setting may influence the result. \nThe checkboxes replace the \"nodes, ways with\" part.

Select key(s) to get color from. Accepts regex and uses matching tags to get a color. The color is derived from key and value of the all matching keys. In case a matching key contains :left/right/both, it will be used to color the respective sides of a way, but not the center line. If there is no match, the color is always red, indicating missing data. Knowledge on regular expressions is very helpful for this feature. 
If the expression is not a regex, prefix '!' to start with the value focused when editing tags. 

Example: 
"surface" shows surface=asphalt in the same color, and surface=concrete in a different color 
".*surface" is similar, but also shows sidewalk:(left/right/both):surface=asphalt in one color, and cycleway:(left/right/both):surface=asphalt in another color
Leave empty to show all in same color
There is a sign or road marking
Restriction relation is incomplete, download of surrounding area required
Click the next way on the map. It needs an end node in common with the current way. Split if necessary.

SCEE

 This is a modified version of StreetComplete. It is intended for experienced users with advanced knowledge about OSM. It gives you more control, but also more responsibility.
 This especially applies to the possibility of editing raw tags and deleting nodes, but also for modification of element selection for quests. Quests added in SCEE may not be answerable in all cases and are disabled by default. Please hide them in case you can’t answer them, and do not spam notes.

 Out of the box SCEE is configured to behave very similar to StreetComplete.
Check for banned versions keeps failing. You might run an outdated version, please consider upgrading.
Start after current search is done
Select a position on a way
Couldn’t start monitoring, possible permission issue
Moving this node will modify geometry of following ways or multipolygon relations: %s.\n Be aware that any changes will not be immediately visible on the background map.
This node is part of following non-multipolygon relations: %s
Note that the position of this quest may not move with the node.
Close note (only do this if you actually solve the note!)
Choose access tags. Remember to tag only signed access, and avoid generic \"access\" tag if possible
This position is outside the downloaded area. Continue?
Parallel to the building’s longer side
Parallel to the building’s shorter side
How is the roof ridge oriented?
"What overall material is this building made of?"
"What overall material is this building part made of?"
